title: Sketch Class: Points of View
short_description: Multi-session sketch class over six weeks
description:
Six Thursdays
August 29–October 3
5:30–7:30

This program is for people ages 16 and up. All materials will be provided. 

Use drawing to investigate the emotional, psychological, or spatial perspective of an artist or artwork. Then, inspired by the Art Institute’s collection, explore how to express your own unique point of view. 

About the Instructor
Leslie Baum is a painter and a museum educator with 25 years of teaching experience. Her paintings are in the Art Institute’s permanent collection and have been exhibited locally, nationally, and internationally. She values the interrelationship between her teaching and painting practices. She received her BA from the University of Vermont and studied painting at the Glasgow School of Art in Glasgow, Scotland.

See all upcoming sketch classes and workshops. For additional information, please call (312) 443-3680 or email museum-programs@artic.edu. 

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
